III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
Description program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that Youth A was looked at by another unknown youth
while taking showers during the weekend of 3/16-3/17/24.
Unknown staff were there but did not see.
Staff (unknown) did not do anything when they heard this
happened.
Investigation On 3/19/24, I left a voicemail for Foster Care Worker 1 and
Complainant 1.
On 3/26/24, I spoke to Administrator 1. Administrator 1 reported
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were working the day of the allegations. The
specific date was unknown at the time of the phone call.
Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 was sitting in the chair in the
bathroom and Staff 2 was out in the hallway directly across from
the bathroom. Administrator 1 reported there is a large barrier
between the showers, and it would not be possible for youth to
look into another youth’s shower. Administrator 1 reported they do
have a video clip of Staff 2 sitting in the hallway during showers.
On 4/11/24, I received a phone call from Foster Care Worker 1.
Foster Care Worker 1 reported she was unaware of any details to
this specific incident.
On 4/11/24, I received a phone call from Complainant 1. No new
information was provided.
Interviews were conducted face to face at the facility on 3/29/24
unless otherwise specified.
2

Interviews:
Youth A:
Youth A reported over the weekend of 3/16 and 3/17, he was
taking a shower in the bathroom and thought he saw a shadow.
Youth A reported he did not see anyone looking at him. Youth A
reported he was in the last shower and Youth B was in the first
shower. Youth A reported there are two showers in between them.
Youth A reported Staff 1 was sitting in the bathroom the entire
time he was showering. Youth A reported he heard Youth B drop
something in his shower and just “freaked out.” Youth A reported
that staff did listen to him after the incident and were trying to help
him.
Youth B:
Youth B reported about two to three weeks ago, Youth A stated a
comment in their group that “something happened.” No one knew
what he was talking about. Youth B did not know what had been
said that happened in the bathroom. Once Youth B was informed
that Youth A reported there was a shadow in the bathroom, Youth
B reported he never left his shower stall at any time. Youth B
reported staff are always sitting in the bathroom and a staff in the
hallway watch the bathroom. Youth B reported youth are to take
showers in stall 1 and stall 4. Youth B reported there are two stalls
in between them.
Staff 1
Staff 1 reported he was working the day that Youth A reported he
saw a shadow in the bathroom. Staff 1 reported no youth left their
showers at any time. Staff 1 reported youth use the 1st and 4th
stalls in the bathroom when showering and a staff sits in the
bathroom between them. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was sitting
outside the bathroom in the hallway with direct line of sight into the
bathroom; able to see him and the showers. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was upset that Youth B was leaving the program. When a
youth leaves a program, they can “pass down” their specific job
they have been responsible for in the program. Youth B held the
secretarial position. Youth A was upset at Youth B because he did
not get the position passed down to him and Staff 1 felt that this
was Youth A’s way of trying to get Youth B in trouble.
Staff 2:
Staff 2 reported she was working the night of the allegations. Staff
2 reported she was sitting in the hallway and Staff 1 was sitting in
the bathroom between the two showers. Staff 1 reported Youth A
was in shower 1 and Youth B was in shower 4. Staff 2 reported
3

Youth A stated he saw a shadow, but no one ever left their shower
stall.
Video Review:
I watched video on 3/16/24 during their evening shower time. Staff
2 is sitting in a chair in the hallway directly across the bathroom.
All other youth are sitting in the hallway quietly waiting for their
turn.
Observation:
I observed the bathroom. There are four showers lined up one
after another. The two middle showers are used for storage of
items and not used. No youth can climb over or under or leave
their shower without staff visibly seeing them.
Document Review:
I reviewed the Shower Expectations:
…staff stands in between the bathroom…5 minute timed
shower…
Analysis Youth A reported he didn’t see anyone, but “freaked out” when he
heard a noise. All reported staff sit in the chair in the bathroom
and one in the hallway. Video, direct observation, and interviews
confirm that no one could look at another youth in the shower
without staff noticing. The Shower Expectations were followed.
Staff completed more than what was expected for staffing the
showers by having an additional staff sit in the hallway looking
directly into the bathroom.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
